719742f-a.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719742f-a.text:
Foley Square (unofficially called Court House Square), east side, between Pearl (right) and Worth (left) Streets, showing the N.Y. County Court House under construction. These 4 views (taken at the same time) show that part of the building that will form the front. On the right
appears the old Board of Health Building.
July 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
719742f-a.folder: Foley Square & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

719743f-c.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719743f-c.text:
Foley Square, east side, between Pearl and Worth Streets, showing the New York County Court House under construction. This set of 4 views shows the Pearl and Baxter Street sides. The fenced area in the foreground is the south side of Worth Street, east of Centre Street. On the right appears the old Board of Health Building. The entrance will be.through the unfinished frame work shown on the right. Centre Street at this
point forms the east side of Foley Square.
July 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
719743f-c.folder: Foley Square & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

The fenced area in the foreground is the south side of Worth Street, east of Centre Street. On the right appears the old Board of Health Building. The entrance will be.through the unfinished frame work shown on the right. Centre Street at this
point forms the east side of Foley Square.
July 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

718562f-a.text:
Centre Street, east side, north from Pearl Street. Buildings shown across the background, are on the north side of Leonard Street, east from Centre to Baxter Streets. The 1-story building in the foreground, is used by the Child Welfare Board, and is on the north side of Worth Street, east of Centre Street. Eventually this will form the site of the N.Y. State
6ffice Building.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
718562f-a.folder: Centre Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

719741f-a.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Duane Street
719741f-a.text:
Foley Square, north from Duane Street, showing the east side of Centre Street (right) and the west side of Lafayette Street (left). Buildings of ipgortance seen are, the Tombs, N.Y. State Building and the N.Y. County Court
Pouse.
March 14, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
719741f-a.folder: Foley Square & Duane Street, Manhattan, NY

719740f-a.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Duane Street
719740f-a.text:
Foley Square, east side, north from Duane Street and showing from right to left the Federal Court Building, the N.Y. County Court House, the N.Y. State Building and the new Board of Health Building.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
719740f-a.folder: Foley Square & Duane Street, Manhattan, NY

719733f-a.text:
Foley Square: The New York County Court House on the east side of Centre Street, between Pearl and Worth Streets, as viewed northward from the stens of the Federal Courts Bldg. At the extreme left
appears a portion of the New York State Bldg.
June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
719733f-a.folder: Centre Street & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

719750f-c.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719750f-c.text:
Foley Square, easterlv side, north from Duane, acroas Pearl, to Worth Streets, showing respectively, The Federal Courts Bldg., the New York County Court House and the New York State Bldg. all
faciug on what technically is Centre Street.
Views 2 and 3 emphasire the New York County Court House and are viewed eastward from Elm Street (the westerly boundary of the square) which in its self is really a continuation of Lafayette
Street.
All of these structures are built upon and around what in early days was Collect Pond and vhere in 1798, John Fitch tried his new steamboat under the ohservation of Chancellor Livingston and other prominent New Yorkers. Where Centre and Leonard Streets intersect today it had a depth of 60 feet. Durinm the Enmlish and French conflict, President Jefferson (1807) ordered an embargo on all shippina and New York suffered. To alleviate same, individuals were set to vork to fill in this pond and morass and thereby set a precedent for public ork relief. A drainage canal was cut thru
in 1809 which later became Canal Street.
Propositions for the use of the area as a Park were introduced as early as 1789, though naught came of them and it remained a dreary vacant area awaiting modern scientific enmineering. Their main difficulty Aas not vater but quicksand and most of these buildings
have whhat is called a floating foundation.
June 12, 1938.
Views 1,2 and 3
P. L. Sperr
719750f-c.folder: Foley Square & Pearl Street, Manhattan, NY

To alleviate same, individuals were set to vork to fill in this pond and morass and thereby set a precedent for public ork relief. A drainage canal was cut thru

have whhat is called a floating foundation.
June 12, 1938.

P. L. Sperr

bVeg ~t.45

October 8, 1933.

at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Duane Street.
February 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

719747f-b.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719747f-b.text:
(1)
Foley Square, east side, north from Pearl Street to Worth Street. Building shown is the New York County Court House. Note on the
extreme right the old Board of Health Building.
June 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
September 24, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
3)
Another view of the Court House. On the extreme right appears a portion
of the Federal Courts Building.
April 18, 1937.
P. L.Sperr.

719748f-c.title: Manhattan: Foley Square - Pearl Street
719748f-c.text:
(1)
The New York County Court Building, fronting on Foley Square, south from but not including Worth to, and including Pearl Streets.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)  The same, from a different angle, showing site for the new Federal
49ourts Building in the foreground.
March 14, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The Court House in its final stages of construction.
May 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same as No. 1. Note the old Board of Health Building still standing
on the right.
October 7, 1930.
Eumene L. Armbruster Collection.
